intro: Dillwynia pungens, commonly known as the yellow dillwynia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and distinctive pod fruits. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is found in regions such as New South Wales and Queensland. Its yellow flowers bloom in spring, adding a vibrant touch to the landscape. The leaves are narrow and often have a slightly hairy texture, contributing to its unique botanical appearance.
